Reviews.Title: “Average hotel near montreal airport”
Reviews.Author: Barricuda
Reviews.Content: To avoid parking fees, we chose this hotel outside the city near the airport. It was difficult to get to because of all the road construction that was going on. There was a wedding reception the night we stayed and it got a bit loud whenever we passed to go into the lobby. The room was average and the price was slightly on the higher side. Would not recommend unless you had just one night and needed quick access to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Boring and Stale, & Avoid the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sirtravelalot1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here more times than I have wanted, and since I travel quite extensively, I feel qualified to tell you to stay away and look elsewhere. The rooms are stale and out of date. The hotel contracts many weddings, and the place a total bore. And, as the title suggests, the restaurant is also subpar. However, with that said, the service has usually been good, and accommodatingâ€”but cheeky, if not rude, once and a while. If you must stay here, ask to stay as far away from the conference facilities, and not above it.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: mcp08
Reviews.Content: I traveled with two female friends and it was wonderful. It was exceptionally clean. The staff is very friendly and each one I met was bilingual. You are guaranteed to find someone that speaks at least two of these: French, Spanish or English. The restaurant is great. They serve you quickly and the food is wonderful. It's a bit far from Old Montreal, but the bus takes you straight to the metro. Pick up a map and you'll be on your way. The ONLY downside, the night bus does not take you infront of the hotel. We learned that if you speak very kindly to the bus drivers (in broken French or English), they will gladly explain to you which transfer to take to make it back to the hotel or they'll take you to the nearest overpass. I do not recommend taking a taxi sitting outside the airport!!! Call the hotel and ask them to send one over for you. They have a list of extremely nice taxi drivers! It will cost about $15-$17 CAD. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle problems”
Reviews.Author: icaretravel53
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself is really nice, but there always seems to be a shuttle problem. When we left for our trip, we needed to get to the airport at about 4-4:30 a.m. - their shuttle only starts at 5:00 a.m., so we had to take a taxi. When we came back, we called for the shuttle and they said it wasn't running, so we should take a taxi and they would pay it. Sounds fine, except the taxi drivers don't like taking short trips, as they don't haul in as much $$. We've run into this problem before. We book the hotel because they keep our car for up to 2 weeks, and we expect a shuttle...... but instead we get to hear grumbling from the taxi drivers. On this trip, the driver didn't even get out of the car at the hotel, so we had to unload our big luggage ourselves. The hotel needs to either figure something out or stop listing shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good rate”
Reviews.Author: Lucas5915
Reviews.Content: We drove by this hotel and chose it. We had not read the (quite negative) reviews on Tripadvisor. And I must say: it is not that bad at all. -The frontdesk was very helpful (giving us useful tips on where to park in Montreal) -Room was clean and absolutely smoke/odor-free -Free parking was nice We paid $110 (incl. taxes) per night and stayed two nights. We did not have breakfast and the pool was 'dry' but it was mid-September and we did not come to Montreal area to use a hotel-pool. Would stay again and will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If you expect kindness, wrong hotel...”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: Old furniture, old TV, old carpet...The room was clean... Unkind personal in both occasions (check-in and check-out) a smile wouldn't hurt...One of the worst customer service we had in Montreal... Unsafe parking lot...Leave nothing in your car... P.S. The breakfast was good...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: shanoa
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its perfect location. Steps away from a bus stop that takes you to the metro, steps away from a restaurant that serves great breakfast and lunch, and from other cafes and restaurants, the location is perfect. But if you want to self-cater Parc Suites is also perfect as the kitchen in my room was a full kitchen and there were 2 or 3 supermarkets close by. The staff is friendly and very helpful and I will definitely stay there again. The free phone calls to Canada and the US are also a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a lover of the unexpected and inexplicable, this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: probate1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Park Inn & Suites Montreal Airport hotel was a strange experience. I called about the advertised airport pick up and was advised that their shuttle was out-of-service. Take a taxi, I was told, and we will reimburse you. Done. The taxi fare to and from the hotel was roughly equal to the room charge. Go figure! (Especially if you OWN this hotel). The hotel was quite a distance from the airport - at least 20 minutes, I would guess. Although there were few other guests, our room was a hike from the front desk. There was a restaurant on site and we were hungry but not hopeful. That is to say, we did not expect much of a meal. Wrong, wrong, wrong. The best aspect of my stay at the hotel was the delicious dinner, in the hotelâ€™s low-key, locals-love-it-here eatery. Do I recommend the hotel? Kind of.. If you are a lover of the unexpected and inexplicable, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A 'thank you' from a happy client ...”
Reviews.Author: A_Flying_Doctor
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, there is nothing wrong about this hotel. The hotel may look industrial like and dated from outside, and located in the industrial area of Montreal. But if you want to sleep in a quiet environment with a comfortable bed to sleep at night. This is the one. These are my comments about this property: 1st : Check In, despite on the Easter holiday, Sunday 24th April 2011, with a hotel staff 'Peter'. Service was quick, professional but friendly with smile. 2nd : Discovered that wireless internet did not work in my room, talked to a hotel staff 'Jerry', who later I found out that he is a FOM. Wireless connection was fixed when I returned to the hotel that afternoon. Jerry was really making sure that everything function fine. Personal thank you for this once again Jerry. 3rd : House keeping service was topnotch, you see yourself, photos are here! When I was here, swimming pool was close so I did not used it. Fitness room required an access code to get in. There was also a guest laundry. Breakfast contains of two choices, American and Continental - not a buffet style. You really need to have a car to make your life easy if you want to move around in and out of Montreal, I rent one, a 4WD, parked in front of the hotel, and nothing wrong seemed to happen during my stay. To sum up, I will definitely come back again next time to this property. I get what I want, a quiet environment, comfortable bed, functioning wireless connection, a small business center with complimentary printing system, a cash machine at the corner, a cozy Italian restaurant at the corner, and free airport shuttle services and polite hotel staffs! To previous comments : I think the hotel has changed its management team. Carlson made a very good job. Finally, two thumbs up to Peter, Jerry the FOM and the House Keeping Staff who I don't know who he/she was. But all what I got was a lot, far more better than a 5* hotel property I previously stayed in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Much better around the airport”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty old property. The ''Business Class'' room that I got really needed some refurbishment. I stayed years ago at this same property when it was a Ramada and it did not change at all with the exception of new carpeting in the hallways. Old carpet in the room, old bed with the disgusting polyester blanket, old TV, old furniture. The bathroom was okay and clean. Old crusty room service trays in the corridor. Windows don't open and AC/heating is from a very old central system. Staff was courteous, airport shuttle on time. It worked for the few hours I have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this Hotel if you want to have a good time”
Reviews.Author: ElGringo3
Reviews.Content: We had room 216; I didn't sleep all night because room 216 is very close to some kind of machine that makes constant wind or rattling noise. The fridge (a cheap make) made a weird buzzing sound; because it didnt sound like a normal sound coming out of a fridge it took me a long time to figure out what was causing the buzzing sound. Unplugging the fridge took care of the buzzing sound but there was still the constant rattling... Couldnt sleep until 5:00AM... Beer is 9$, one ounce of amaretto cost us 7$... prices for drinks are completely unrealistic when considering the budget category this Hotel sits in.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: JP19
Reviews.Content: Let's keep this simple. Don't stay here. Just don't. I get it, you want cheap accomodations near the airport, maybe even with long-term parking available. That's what I was looking for too. But you get what you pay for. The motel is in a very sketchy industrial area that does not seem safe at all. Sure enough there are billboard-size signs everywhere (and a waiver to sign for long-term parking) stating that basically if you park there, your car is likely to be stolen and/or vandalized. Looking around, it's not surprising. The rooms are dated, the hallways are dark and very reminiscent of The Shining, and the whole thing just feels dingy and depressing. BUT I would have been willing to overlook ALL of that if not for the incredibly rude service I received from the desk clerk who very reluctantly checked me in when I arrived at 10:00 pm after a very difficult journey. He got my reservation completely wrong, blamed me for it, and even when he realized the mistake was his, would not admit it or apologize. I have stayed in many motels and hotels in my life and have never received such awful customer service. The owners should be ashamed. Just steer clear. Do yourself a favor. Spend a few extra dollars and stay somewhere safe, where they might actually smile at you when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, No Respect for Guests”
Reviews.Author: Marvin427
Reviews.Content: Maybe because we arrived at 11pm last night (8/14), but the receptionist wasn't very welcoming - wasn't because I looked tired from traveling all day? I asked if they had any double beds and she said $85/nite. They didn't appear full and likely had a number of rooms available. So I asked if a discounted rate was available, she said no. I asked the cost including tax, she said $99.37. So, I said okay we'll take it. She asked me the number of people, I told her 2 adults and 3 children. As she processed my credit card I asked about the weather, about a church for tomorrow Sunday. After she finished, I asked her if we could get a folding bed since we had 5 people in our party, she said that housekeeping was closed and we couldn't - that it would also cost extra. So I'm thinking, Well, okay now what do I do. She offered no solutions and left it at that. So, I thought okay, we'll just make do. She gave us room 102, directly across from the Housekeeping office. So guess what, we hear all kinds of noise at 7am waking us up. The floors are all tiled, not carpeted so we hear the carts and people walking by our room and the noise just echoes down the hall. The cleaning staff (bless their hearts) are chatting and laughing. And then, someone opens our door!!! Aaaaaahhhhhh!! Never again.... in Montreal........

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, Car Theft Capital of the airport strip.”
Reviews.Author: timhortoncan
Reviews.Content: My wife and two sma;; children stayed there the July 1st long weekend. We should have took heed from the signs we saw when you enter the parking lot. They have multiple large signs all over the parking lot warning "guests" that the hotel is not responsible for theft and/or vandilism of your vehicle. When we checked in the front desk clerk directed us to park our SUV at the back of the building by a rear entrance. Not to sure if it was for our convenience or possibly because it is not well lit and remove from the street view and not visible to their supposedly 6 operating cameras. Our stay was terrible the room was dingy and smelly, the hall smelled of cigarettes and nothing appeared to be cleaned in years, probably why Ramada took off their name from this property. I had convinced my wife to bear the intolerable conditions as we were only going to spend a few hours a night there to get some sleep, she wanted to leave and find a new place...should've listened. Sunday morning at 5:30am went down to start loading our SUV to come back home and not to my surprise and amazement our truck was gone. The front desk staff was completely useless and seemed shocked that a vehicle would be stolen from their parking lot. She kept asking me if I had actually parked at the hotel, wish I would have read this web site first, I would have realised that it is quite a hotspot for car theft. I would suggest to anyone considering a stay here to keep searching believe me it is no deal.

Reviews.Title: “Broken lights, cobwebs and smelly!”
Reviews.Author: billyrotten
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't as bad as some of the other reviews have said. It was cheap and the staff were helpful and polite, but there were too many negatives. The negatives: location on one side of a divided highway made it difficult to get to, bedside light half broken, cobwebs throughout, tub wouldn't drain (full of hair, yuck!), bathroom exhaust fan didn't work, room and hallway smelled of cigarette smoke and musty, fitness centre minimal, pool area sparce and looked poorly kept, restaurant too expensive, coffee machine poorly stocked, TV very small and old, the business centre's computers were slow and the printer only worked for one computer. The only reason we ended up here was that hotwire picked it for us as a cheap 3-star hotel. I'd give it 1-2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “too much noise”
Reviews.Author: tertpo
Reviews.Content: there was a continuous noise for 24 hours coming from the basement. It should be a generator or something like that. We couldn't sleep at all. I can still hear that truck noise in my head. First things first, people go to hotels to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: kimbra66
Reviews.Content: I recently had the misfortune to spend a night at the Park Inn. In nearly 40 years of travelling, I 've come to the conclusion that there are good hotels, bad hotels and Hotels from Hell. The Park Inn fits the latter. The hallways have signs saying "be quiet, people are trying to sleep". This isn't out of courtesy, it's because the walls are paper thin. The front desk staff are just out of high school and clueless. They advertise a pool and a restaurant . The pool is bone dry, and the restaurant is probably closed more than its open. Do yourselves a favor, avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: aimerlesoleil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were to spend a night there. We checked in, and we checked out three hours later! We had booked a smoking room, but the odor of cigarette smoke was so thick, it made my eyes sore, and we were in there only 5 minutes. Since the windows do not open, we could not air out the place. We switched our room to a non-smoking room, but it was small, not very clean (especially the bathroom), and again, the air was very stale. The outdoor pool was not useable, and the restaurant was closed. We decided to leave. The quality of service left a lot to be desired. The clerk at the front desk was shy, not vey experienced, and hard to understand at times. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking??”
Reviews.Author: Lefty_59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on May 22nd. We had a reservation for a 2 double bed room but on arrival we were told that there were none left. After a long but friendly discussion with a man at the reception he offered us a free American breakfast the next morning to compensate for their error.

Reviews.Title: “SKETCHY HOTEL - TRUCK STOLEN WHILE ON VACATION”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaJay89
Reviews.Content: This is a sketchy hotel, in a terrible neighbourhood. We stayed at the hotel before flying out of Trudeau early the next morning, and left our truck for the duration of our trip. While on vacation, our truck was stolen from the parking lot - not as rare occurance as we thought. Apparently our truck was one of 12 vehicles stolen in the past 4 months from that hotel, but they don't advertise that on the website. When we talked to the woman at the front desk, she mentioned that "this always happened on her shift!" If you value your vehicle at all, DO NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back to this hotel or Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Nikasmom2009
Reviews.Content: For our first time in Montreal I have to say that I was left with absolutely no desire to return to this hotel or city...ever. We travelled with 2 other couples & our dog for the weekend. The hotel was small & decent, the only good thing was that it accomodates pets. Our room was pretty dated & stunk like it hadnt been cleaned or freshend up at all. The continenetal breakfast was good but we all ended up spending $10 + on breakfast that was not very filling. The staff was alright, very rude at times. Overall this hotel & city get a 5/10. We were not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchiest hotel in Canada - a race to the bottom in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Cheocheo
Reviews.Content: There is good reason Air Canada uses this place for their stranded passengers. While the place is for the most part clean, the beds must be 30 years old, the linens are so threadbare you can see right through them... and the staff... well, I caught the receptionist trying to steal $12 from Air Canada (he took my Air Canada voucher, signed it off, entered it, then refused to issue the meal voucher from it). The rooms are noisy - don't try to sleep past 8:00 - the cleaners will keep you awake - noise from work in adjacent rooms and hallway. And the restaurant - well, pathetic. The service was quick, but there is nothing on the menu to order that falls within the $7 breakfast/$12lunch that Air Canada tries to issue. Furthermore, they make McDonalds look like 5 stars. To top it off, your server will try to add a tip to your bill, for whatever he thinks you should tip him - even if you are eating alone. Basically, the goal of this hotel is to pocket as much money from AC and stranded passengers as possible - knowing fully that you didn't choose to stay here in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Disgrace!!!”
Reviews.Author: MartinPToronto
Reviews.Content: After being in transit for almost 24 hours, the last leg of our flight (Toronto - Montreal) was cancelled, and Air Canada provided us with a "voucher" to stay at the Park Inn before flying out the next morning. We were taken on a shuttle bus from the airport, and the desk clerk refused to acknowledge the Air Canada vouchers. He berated us, along with all the other "guests" (many of them who were not from Canada and did not speak English). He told us to "pay or get out". We left. I wouldn't stay in that hell-hole if it was the last place on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: ILuVSuNsHiNeOttawa
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Park Inn the night before our one week trip to Mexico. We booked 3 rooms and parked 2 cars. The rooms are very outdated and they smell really bad. We had to burn candles to get rid of the smell. This hotel may have a very welcoming lobby but the rooms are horrible. The shuttle was ok. On our way home, the driver was very rude. The worst part of our stay is that our brand new SUV was broken into. Pannels were removed on the inside and the ignition was completly dismantled. You would think the hotel would keep an eye on your vehicule while you're away. Plus when we told the front desk about it they basicly brushed us off and told us that this happens all the time. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before a flight!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelVT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove up from Vermont to take an early morning flight out of Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport. We had heard that this hotel allowed us to leave our car here for the week we were gone. We were greeted by the very friendly desk clerk and signed up for the early morning shuttle for the airport. Our room was clean and tidy. As we were very tired, we ate at the restaurant downstairs and were pleased with the delicious food at reasonable prices. The shuttle was waiting as promised and took us quickly to the airport. Upon our return, we called the hotel and waited less than 10 minutes for the shuttle to bring us back to our car. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: mary8209
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before last year when it was the Ramada, i was happy then with the service and facilities, especially the restaurant...There has been many changes to this hotel i guess since the name changed and it's absolutely great! The service at the front desk whether you ask for local attractions or directions is amzaing! Check in and Out is very quick and efficient! The hotel's Restaurant Venezia has great food and very affordable prices. The Mattresses are soooo comfy! Shuttle service was quick and on time. All in all i thik this hotel is a definite 4 star for the area! I highly recommend you stay there next time in montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor, Run-Down, Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn at the Montreal Airport was a *horrible* hotel. This dump did not even compare to the oldest comfort inn you can imagine. This is ***NOT*** a 3* property. It was dumped recently by the Ramada Chain for VERY obvious reasons. The hotel is extremely old and run to the ground. Every bit of the hotel (minus the front enterance and lobby) is in need of extreme renovations. The walls in the hallway are crumbling and in some cases boarded up. The carpets are warn to the ground, stained, and smell of wet dog. The rooms are just plain pitiful; The bathroom tiles were mostly cracked and missing grout. The bathroom ceiling was mouldy crumbling industrial ceiling tiles (the particle board kind), which is extremely stupid to put in a bathroom. The bed was old and broken. They tried to piece it together with some new 2x4's and nails. The matress was equally terrible, very soft, and had springs that were poking out all over the place. The TV was a 15inch old CRT tube TV that barely got 10 channels. The only good thing about the trip was the shuttle was convenient to the airport... but usually very late. I would advise against staying here, try the comfort inn... its cheaper and a million times better.
